metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2054 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the seccomp implementation prior to kernel version 4.8, there is apossible seccomp bypass due to seccomp policies that allow the use ofptrace. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additionalexecution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID:A-119769499

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1050.54
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-157.185~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1050.54').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
